security: Disclosing details about individuals disqualified from nuclear weapons programs due to drug use or personal associations could risk their privacy and potentially compromise security protocols. Quoting the document: 'Disqualified from nuclear weapons as part of 611-5 program because of use of drugs. Myers was engaged to Eva-Maria Dorka...'
summary: An agent report from February 5, 1972, details personnel record checks within the 66th USA Artillery Detachment in Datteln, FRG, revealing that Clyde E. Myers was disqualified from a nuclear weapons program due to drug use and was engaged to Eva-Maria Dorka.
summary_one_paragraph: This agent report, dated February 5, 1972, summarizes findings from personnel record checks conducted on C Team, 66th USA Artillery Detachment, stationed in Datteln, Federal Republic of Germany. The checks, aided by 1LT FNU Kulesza, revealed that PFC Clyde E. Myers, who arrived at the unit in December 1968 and departed in November 1971, was disqualified from nuclear weapons duties under the 611-5 program due to drug use. Myers was also noted to be engaged to Eva-Maria Dorka from Gelsinkirchen, FRG. The report also indicates that no one by the name of Jackson or Julius had ever been stationed at C Team.
title: Agent Report
